meanings.definition: A sudden strong and unreflective urge or desire to act.
meanings.sent1: Her impulsions to eat ice cream always come out of nowhere.
meanings.sent2: His impulsions to run in the park are always so spontaneous.
meanings.sent3: The cat's impulsions to chase the laser pointer never fail to entertain us.
meanings.sent4: The impulsions of the waves crashing against the shore are relentless.
meanings.sent5: The child's impulsions to jump in puddles were impossible to resist.

meanings.definition: The action of impelling or driving forward.
meanings.sent1: The impulsions of the car's engine made it speed up.
meanings.sent2: The impulsions of the river carried the raft downstream.
meanings.sent3: The impulsions of the wind against the sail propelled the boat forward.
meanings.sent4: The impulsions of the crowd pushed everyone towards the stage.
meanings.sent5: The impulsions of the rocket engines lifted the spacecraft into the sky.
